verbs.description: sightsee (third-person singular simple present sightsees, present participle sightseeing, simple past sightsaw, past participle sightseen)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To go sightseeing; to visit places of interest in a city, town or geographical area.
examples: The German team liked each other, ate, drank, sightsaw, sunbathed and worked their horses together. All were firmly rooting for Ludwig. A German victory was all that mattered.
